result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Medlin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Programming as deemed appropriate by the agent.

miscConds.notes: Total costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Reimbursement for attorney fees to be returned to Ozaukee County Clerk of Courts.

Defendant to submit to random testing. Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Defendant must submit DNA sample while in custody. Pay supervision fees.
-1- day credit if revoked
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel

Defendant Michael R Medlin in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Def may or may not qualify for public defender representation. Court finds probable cause.  State requests $500 cash bail with conditions.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
